member.summary: Represents the result of OAuth or OpenID authentication.

member.summary: Returns an instance which indicates failed authentication.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:DotNetOpenAuth.AspNet.AuthenticationResult.Error
member.summary: Gets the error that may have occured during the authentication process

member.name: P:DotNetOpenAuth.AspNet.AuthenticationResult.ExtraData
member.summary: Gets the optional extra data that may be returned from the provider

member.name: P:DotNetOpenAuth.AspNet.AuthenticationResult.IsSuccessful
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the authentication step is successful.
member.value: true if authentication is successful; otherwise, false .

member.name: P:DotNetOpenAuth.AspNet.AuthenticationResult.Provider
member.summary: Gets the provider's name.

member.name: P:DotNetOpenAuth.AspNet.AuthenticationResult.ProviderUserId
member.summary: Gets the user id that is returned from the provider. It is unique only within the Provider's namespace.

member.name: P:DotNetOpenAuth.AspNet.AuthenticationResult.UserName
member.summary: Gets an (insecure, non-unique) alias for the user that the user should recognize as himself/herself.
member.value: This may take the form of an email address, a URL, or any other value that the user may recognize.
member.remarks: This alias may come from the Provider or may be derived by the relying party if the Provider does not supply one. It is not guaranteed to be unique and certainly does not merit any trust in any suggested authenticity.

member.summary: Attempts to authenticate users by forwarding them to an external website, and upon succcess or failure, redirect users back to the specified url.
member.param: The context of the current request.
The return url after users have completed authenticating against external website.

member.summary: Check if authentication succeeded after user is redirected back from the service provider.
member.param: The context of the current request.
member.returns: An instance of containing authentication result.

member.summary: Stores a newly generated unauthorized request token, secret, and optional application-specific parameters for later recall.
member.param: The request message that resulted in the generation of a new unauthorized request token.

member.summary: Deletes a request token and its associated secret and stores a new access token and secret.
member.param: The Consumer that is exchanging its request token for an access token.
The Consumer's request token that should be deleted/expired.
The new access token that is being issued to the Consumer.
The secret associated with the newly issued access token.

member.name: T:DotNetOpenAuth.AspNet.Clients.InMemoryOAuthTokenManager
member.summary: An implementation of IOAuthTokenManager which stores keys in memory.

member.name: F:DotNetOpenAuth.AspNet.Clients.InMemoryOAuthTokenManager.tokensAndSecrets
member.summary: The _tokens and secrets.

member.name: M:DotNetOpenAuth.AspNet.Clients.InMemoryOAuthTokenManager.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:DotNetOpenAuth.AspNet.Clients.InMemoryOAuthTokenManager.ExpireRequestTokenAndStoreNewAccessToken(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Deletes a request token and its associated secret and stores a new access token and secret.
member.param: The Consumer that is exchanging its request token for an access token.
The Consumer's request token that should be deleted/expired.
The new access token that is being issued to the Consumer.
The secret associated with the newly issued access token.

remarks.para:
Any scope of granted privileges associated with the request token from the original call to
should be carried over to the new Access Token.

To associate a user account with the new access token, HttpContext.Current.User may be useful in an ASP.NET web application within the implementation of this method. Alternatively you may store the access token here without associating with a user account, and wait until
or
return the access token to associate the access token with a user account at that point.

member.name: M:DotNetOpenAuth.AspNet.Clients.InMemoryOAuthTokenManager.GetTokenSecret(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the Token Secret given a request or access token.
member.returns: The secret associated with the given token.
member.exception: Thrown if the secret cannot be found for the given token.

member.name: M:DotNetOpenAuth.AspNet.Clients.InMemoryOAuthTokenManager.GetTokenType(System.String)
member.summary: Classifies a token as a request token or an access token.
member.returns: Request or Access token, or invalid if the token is not recognized.

member.name: M:DotNetOpenAuth.AspNet.Clients.InMemoryOAuthTokenManager.StoreNewRequestToken(DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.Messages.UnauthorizedTokenRequest,DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.Messages.ITokenSecretContainingMessage)
member.summary: Stores a newly generated unauthorized request token, secret, and optional application-specific parameters for later recall.
member.param: The request message that resulted in the generation of a new unauthorized request token.
The response message that includes the unauthorized request token.
member.exception: Thrown if the consumer key is not registered, or a required parameter was not found in the parameters collection.
member.remarks: Request tokens stored by this method SHOULD NOT associate any user account with this token. It usually opens up security holes in your application to do so. Instead, you associate a user account with access tokens (not request tokens) in the method.

member.summary: Gets the consumer key.

member.name: P:DotNetOpenAuth.AspNet.Clients.InMemoryOAuthTokenManager.ConsumerSecret
member.summary: Gets the consumer secret.

member.name: T:DotNetOpenAuth.AspNet.MachineKeyUtil
member.summary: Provides helpers that mimic the ASP.NET 4.5 MachineKey.Protect / Unprotect APIs, even when running on ASP.NET 4.0. Consumers are expected to follow the same conventions used by the MachineKey.Protect / Unprotect APIs (consult MSDN docs for how these are meant to be used). Additionally, since this helper class dynamically switches between the two based on whether the current application is .NET 4.0 or 4.5, consumers should never persist output from the Protect method since the implementation will change when upgrading 4.0 -> 4.5. This should be used for transient data only.

member.name: F:DotNetOpenAuth.AspNet.MachineKeyUtil.MachineKeyImpl
member.summary: MachineKey implementation depending on the target .NET framework version

member.name: M:DotNetOpenAuth.AspNet.MachineKeyUtil.Protect(System.Byte[],System.String[])
member.summary: Protects the specified user data.

member.name: M:DotNetOpenAuth.AspNet.MachineKeyUtil.Unprotect(System.Byte[],System.String[])
member.summary: Unprotects the specified protected data.

member.name: M:DotNetOpenAuth.AspNet.MachineKeyUtil.GetMachineKeyImpl
member.summary: Gets the machine key implementation based on the runtime framework version.

member.name: T:DotNetOpenAuth.AspNet.MachineKeyUtil.ProtectUnprotect
member.summary: ProtectUnprotect delegate.
member.returns: Result of either Protect or Unprotect methods.

member.summary: Abstract the MachineKey implementation in .NET 4.0 and 4.5

member.summary: Protects the specified user data.

member.summary: Unprotects the specified protected data.

member.summary: Protects the specified user data.

member.summary: Unprotects the specified protected data.

member.summary: Convert bytes to hex string.

member.name: M:DotNetOpenAuth.AspNet.MachineKeyUtil.MachineKey40.AreByteArraysEqual(System.ArraySegment{System.Byte},System.ArraySegment{System.Byte})
member.summary: This method is specially written to take the same amount of time regardless of where 'a' and 'b' differ. Please do not optimize it.

members.member: Computes a SHA256 hash over all of the input parameters. Each parameter is UTF8 encoded and preceded by a 7-bit encoded integer describing the encoded byte length of the string. The parameters. The output hash

member.summary: Convert hdex string to bytes.
